properties.description: Posted by JadelmanA.G. Geiger\'s placeA.G. Geiger\'s place was a store frontage on the north side of the boulevard near Las Palmas. (p. 22, Big Sleep)

properties.name: Bristol Apartments
properties.description: Posted by Jadelman340 S LA FAYETTE PARK PL, los angeles, ca"Call me at any time then. My number is in the phone book, too. Bristol Apartments, Apartment 428." [p. 15, Little Sister]

properties.name: Bullocks Wilshire
properties.description: Posted by Jadelman3050 Wilshire Boulevard, los angeles, caThe motor of the gray Plymouth throbbed under her voice and the rain pounded above it. The violet light at the top of Bullock\'s green-tinged tower was far above us, serene and withdrawn from the dark, dripping city. [p. 179, Big Sleep]

properties.name: Cat and Fiddle
properties.description: Posted by Jadelman6530 sunset blvd, los angeles, ca

properties.name: Encino
properties.description: Posted by JadelmanEncino, caI drove east on Sunset but I didn\'t go home. At La Brea I turned north and swung over to Highland, out over Cahuenga Pass and down on to Ventura Boulevard, past Studio City and Sherman Oaks and Encino. There was nothing lonely about the trip. There never is on that road. [p.79, Little Sister]

properties.name: Fairfax
properties.description: Posted by JadelmanI stopped at Fairfax with the green light to let a man make a left turn. Horns blew violently behind.."I used to like this town," I said, just to be saying something and not thinking too hard. "A long time ago. There were trees along Wilshire Boulevard. Beverly Hills was a country town. Westwood was bare hills and lots offering at eleven-hundred dollars and no takers. Hollywood was a bunch of frame houses on the interurban line. Los Angeles was just a big dry sunny place with ugly homes and no style, but goodhearted and peaceful. It had the climate thy just yap about now. People used to sleep on porches. Little groups who thought they were intellectual used to call it the Athens of America. It wasn\'t Athens, but it wasn\'t a neon-lighted slum either." [p.183, Little Sister]

properties.name: Fulwider Building
properties.description: Posted by JadelmanMy rubber heels slithered on the sidewalk as I turned into the narrow lobby of the Fulwider Building...Painless dentists, shyster detective agencies, small sick businesses that had crawled there to die, mail order schools that would teach you how to become a railroad clerk or a radio technician or a screen writer--if the postal inspectors didn\'t catch up with them first. A nasty building. A building in which the smell of stale cigar butts would be the cleanest odor. [p. 170, Big Sleep]

properties.name: Hobart Arms
properties.description: Posted by JadelmanHobart Arms. Franklin near Kenmore. [pg. 151, Big Sleep]

properties.name: Holdup
properties.description: Posted by Jadelman 3966 S San Pedro St, los angeles caThe police loudspeaker box on the wall put out a bulletin about a holdup on San Pedro south of Forty-fourth. The holdup was a middle-aged man wearing a dark gray suit and gray felt hat. He was last seen running east on Forty-fourth and then dodging between two houses. "Approach carefully," the announcer said. "The suspect is armed with a .32 calliber revolver and has just held up the proprietor of a Greek restaurant at Number 3966 South San Pedro."

properties.name: Jesse Florian's House
properties.description: Posted by Jadelman 1644 W. 54th St., los angeles, ca1644 West 54th Place was a dried-out brown house with a dried-out brown lawn in front of it. There was a large bare patch around a tough-looking palm tree. On the porch stood one lonely wooden rocker, and the afternoon breeze made the unpruned shoots of last year\'s poinsettias tap-tap against the cracked stucco wall. [p.26-7, Farewell, My Lovely

properties.name: Los Balcones del Peru
properties.description: Posted by Jadelman1360 N. Vine Street Hollywood, los angeles, ca

properties.name: Malibu
properties.description: Posted by JadelmanMalibu. More movie stars. More pink and blue bathtubs. More tufted beds. More Chanel No. 5. More Lincoln Continentals and Cadillacs. More wind-blown hair and sunglasses and attitudes and pseudo-refined voices and waterfront morals. [p.81, Little Sister]

properties.name: Mavis Weld's Apartment
properties.description: Posted by Jadelman999 N Doheny Dr, Los Angeles, CAThe apartment house was over on Doheny Drive, just down the hill from the Strip. It was really two buildings, one behide the other, loosely connected by a floored patio with a fountain, and a room built over the arch. [p.67, Little Sister]

properties.name: Mercury
properties.description: Posted by Jadelman3110 Wilshire blvd., los angeles, ca

properties.name: Murrieta
properties.description: Posted by JadelmanMurrieta, ca

properties.name: Oxnard Cutoff
properties.description: Posted by JadelmanI drove on to the Oxnard cut-off and turned back along the ocean. The big eight-wheelers and sixteen wheelers were all streaming north, all hung over with orange lights. On the right the great fat solid Pacific trudging into shore like a srubwoman going home. Nosmell. None of the harsh wild smell of the sea. A California ocean. California, the department store stae. The most of everything and the best of nothing. [p.80, Little Sister]

properties.name: Second Street Tunnel
properties.description: Posted by JadelmanThe muzzle of the Luger looked like the mouth of the Second Street tunnel, but I didn\'t move. [p. 73, Big Sleep]

properties.name: Smelling Los Angeles
properties.description: Posted by JadelmanI smelled Los Angeles before I got to it. It smelled stale and old like a living room that had been closed too long. But the colored lights fooled you. The lights were wonderful. [p.81, Little Sister]

properties.name: Solair Wilshire
properties.description: Posted by Jadelman

properties.name: Steak Dinner
properties.description: Posted by JadelmanSteak DinnerI ate dinner at a place near Thousand Oaks. Bad but quick... [p.80, Little Sister]

properties.name: Taggart Wilde's Home
properties.description: Posted by JadelmanTaggart Wilde, the District Attorney, lived at the corner of Fourth and Lafayette Park, in a white frame house the size of a carbarn, with a red sandstone porte-cochere built on to one side and a couple of acres of soft rolling lawn in front. It was one of those solid old-fashioned houses which it used to be the thing to move bodily to new locations as the city grew westward. Wilde came of an old Los Angeles family and had probably been born in the house when it was on West Adams or Figueroa or St. James Park. [pg. 105, Big Sleep]

properties.name: The Dancers
properties.description: Posted by JadelmanOn the terrace of The Dancers a few early birds were getting ready to drink their lunch. The glass-fronted upstairs room had the awning let down into the Strip and stopped across the street from a square building of two stories of rose-brick with small white leaded bay windows and a Greek porch over the front door and what looked, from across the street, like an antique pewter doorknob. [p.105, Little Sister]

properties.name: The La Baba
properties.description: Posted by JadelmanHe walked west, swinging his cane in a small tight arc just above his right shoe...We went about a block and a half. At the Highland Avenue traffic signal I pulled up beside him and let him see me...We crossed Highland with the green light and made another block...He turned right. A hundred feet up the hill he stopped and hooked his cane over his arm...He almost raised dust going up the block...He turned left again...This was a narrow tree lined street with a retaining wall on one side and three bungalow courts on the other...I loafed along the block peering this way and that. At the second bungalow court I saw something. It was called "The La Baba," a quiet dim place with a double row of tree shaded bungalows. The central walk was lined with Italian cypresses trimmed short and chunky, something the shape of olive jars in Ali Baba and the Forty Thieves. Behind the third jar a loud-patterned sleeve edge moved. [p. 27, Big Sleep]

properties.name: Van Nuys Hotel
properties.description: Posted by Jadelman 103 w 4th st. los angeles, ca"Room 332, Van Nuys Hotel. Knock two quick ones and two slow ones. Not too loud." [p. 42, Little Sister] Once, long ago, it must have had a certain elegence. But no more. The memories of old cigars clung to its lobby like the dirty gilt on its ceiling and the sagging springs of its leather lounging chairs. The marble of the desk had turned a yellowish brown with age. But the floor carpet was new and had a hard look, like the room clerk. I passed him and strolled over to the cigar counter in the corner and put down a quarter for a package of Camels. [p.44] The porter\'s room was halfway down the corridor to the Spring Street entrance. [p. 45]
